title: White House Memo: Furloughed Workers May Need New Law for Back Pay
snippets: A new draft White House memo suggests a 2019 law signed by President Trump that guarantees federal employees get paid after a shutdown ends would not apply to furloughed workers.

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihAFBVV95cUxQeTdNcElLQ2hOX1pDXzdzZktyX2t2M2lheUM5YlMxZ0sxODRybHJWMXpaeW1OU3EzbWp4ZFRhYjcwV0lYY1lsTkhDdEtpeGx3Z2FTM3RJMUpPRUJ0MTZsYVlJMUtxU2pucWlLbXBtY1NPRWNDODZjNDlkdXZjd1hxUWRYRjQ?oc=5" target="_blank">Scoop: White House memo says furloughed federal

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMiiAFBVV95cUxPUS1lYl9GYkRZTWZLaTRhZ0dCMjg1SGJXUUpzdVpoUzdCTjB6VFpuUmpEX2lLMF82N0xtdURXZFY1aUtnZmZQN2FhWUc4ZjY1UWRsNldxaDJ3ZW9VZHJyU2xOeHFVUHliZXJ3OE1zY00tOVRjY1J5cnp6aWRObXhXakY3RFhwQktj?oc=5" target="_blank">Congress erupts over "lawless" Trump threat

OMB argues an amendment to a 2019 act would not guarantee furloughed workers post-shutdown pay

The White House’s office of management and budget (OMB) is arguing that federal workers who are furloughed amid the ongoing government shutdown are not entitled to back pay.

In a draft memo
The government shutdown began at midnight on Wednesday as Democrats and Republicans appeared to be nowhere close to reaching a funding deal.
As the federal shutdown stretches on, furloughed federal workers face the threat of not receiving back pay, despite a 2019 law that requires it.
titles: White House floats no back pay for some furloughed federal workers despite 2019 law
Scoop: White House memo says furloughed federal workers aren't entitled to back pay - Axios
Congress erupts over "lawless" Trump threat not to pay back furloughed federal workers - Axios
White House says furloughed federal workers not entitled to back pay amid shutdown
Government Shutdown: White House Considers Not Paying Furloughed Federal Workers Once Government Reopens
Furloughed federal workers face threat of no back pay from shutdown, despite 2019 law requiring it
summary: A draft memo from the White House indicates that furloughed federal employees may not automatically receive back pay for the period they were not working. It suggests that new legislation from Congress would be required to authorize such payments.

title: 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics Awarded for Quantum Tech Advances
snippets: The Nobel committee said that the laureates' work provides opportunities to develop "the next generation of quantum technology, including quantum cryptography, quantum computers, and quantum sensors."
The announcement was made by the Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences in Stockholm.
John Clarke, Michel Devoret and John Martinis have won the 2025 physics Nobel Prize for their work in quantum mechanics. It is the second Nobel Prize to be awarded this year.
The 2025 Nobel prize in physics has gone to John Clarke, Michel Devoret and John Martinis, whose work has led to the development of today's quantum computers
titles: The Nobel Prize for physics is awarded for discoveries in quantum mechanical tunneling
Physics Nobel awarded to three scientists for work on quantum computing
Nobel Prize in physics goes to US-based trio for discoveries in quantum mechanics
Nobel prize for physics goes to trio behind quantum computing chips
summary: John Clarke, Michel Devoret, and John Martinis were awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Physics for their pioneering work in quantum mechanics, specifically advancing the development of quantum technology, including quantum computers, cryptography, and sensors. Their research has been crucial in demonstrating how quantum mechanics' properties can have practical applications in technology. The Royal Swedish Academy of Sciences in Stockholm announced the award, highlighting the trio's contributions as foundational to digital technology's future.

title: McGregor Ineligible for UFC Till March 2026 After Missing Drug Tests
snippets: McGregor's suspension ends before the UFC White House card next summer
McGregor missed three drug tests in 2024 – on 13 June, 19 September, and 20 September
Conor McGregor will be ineligible to compete in any UFC event until March 2026.
titles: Conor McGregor suspended 18 months for UFC anti-doping violation
Conor McGregor hit with 18-month UFC doping ban after whereabouts failures
McGregor accepts 18-month UFC sanction for anti-doping violation
summary: Conor McGregor, after missing three drug tests in 2024 on June 13, September 19, and September 20, will be ineligible to compete in UFC events until March 2026, despite his suspension ending before the UFC White House card next summer.

title: Tesla Launches Cheaper Model Y and 3, Prices Start at $36,990
snippets: Elon Musk has said his automaker would sell an affordable Model Y, as “people don’t have enough money in the bank account to buy it” despite high demand.
Newly announced trims still hover closer to $40,000 than $30,000 — a price that many investors view as putting the vehicle within mass-market reach.
The long-awaited cheaper Model 3 and Model Y are finally here, but they start at $36,990 and $39,990, respectively -- just a few thousand dollars less than Tesla's current offerings.
titles: Tesla Unveils Cheaper Model Y And Model 3—Countering Tax Credit Loss
Tesla just unveiled a cheaper Model Y and Model 3. Why the stock is falling.
Tesla reveals slightly cheaper ‘standard’ versions of the Model 3 and Model Y
summary: Elon Musk announced Tesla will sell more affordable versions of the Model Y to meet high demand, acknowledging the current price is too high for many consumers. The cheaper trims of the Model Y and Model 3 are now available, starting at $39,990 and $36,990, respectively. These prices, while lower, remain closer to $40,000, slightly missing the mass-market target price of under $30,000 that investors hoped for.

title: Supreme Court Reviews State Power on Conversion Therapy Bans
snippets: Supreme Court seems skeptical of conversion therapy ban&n

<a href="https://news.google.com/rss/articles/CBMihwFBVV95cUxOeFV5Q0JvZFFfYmdGV1hpd0VWdTBhTXpQU3gwaVZyMWxVQ1A4ejVHc21fbFhnTVR3OFE1ZlVUOTcxakRVWHdqOVBlUnMzMUhBZzRoVzJEa1paWUhsRnRFa1BTMmtPXzZIbEprQ1M1WjdmYUVXZHBtakFWaG5zQTVRVDA1cE9mSHc?oc=5" target="_blank">Supreme Court weighs case on conversion ther
California and 20 other states that forbid licensed counselors to practice 'conversion therapy' face a free-speech challenge.
Justices expressed skepticism of Colorado's argument that it's allowed to regulate how therapists counsel their patients about their sexuality or gender identity.
titles: Supreme Court seems skeptical of conversion therapy ban - Axios
Supreme Court weighs case on conversion therapy for youth - Axios
Supreme Court sees a free-speech problem with laws that ban 'conversion therapy' for minors
Supreme Court Suggests It Could Limit Bans On LGBTQ Conversion Therapy—What To Know
summary: The Supreme Court is reviewing a case that examines if states have the authority to regulate conversations between counselors and clients, specifically focusing on the legality of conversion therapy bans. This case has ignited a conflict between conservative Christian groups and the LGBTQ+ community, with significant implications for both freedom of speech and the rights of LGBTQ+ individuals. The outcome is pending.

title: Connor McDavid Signs $25M, 2-Year Deal with Oilers, Prioritizes Team Success

Friedman: McDavid’s ‘Crosby-esque’ discount shows commitment to winning
summary: Connor McDavid has signed a two-year, US$25 million contract extension with the Edmonton Oilers, emphasizing his dedication to pursuing team success over maximum salary. The hockey community's response to this decision was analyzed by NHL insider Elliotte Friedman on Sportsnet.

title: Trump Warns of Job Losses Amid Shutdown; Back Pay Uncertain for Federal Workers

summary: Former President Trump warned that a prolonged government shutdown could result in a significant number of jobs not returning. Additionally, a White House memo, covered by multiple US media outlets, indicated plans to not guarantee back pay for federal workers laboring through the shutdown. Meanwhile, a federal judge in Illinois has yet to block these measures, leaving the situation unresolved as attention shifts to Capitol Hill for further developments.

title: Bengals Acquire QB Joe Flacco from Browns to Boost Playoff Hopes

title: Rain Delays Game 3 of AL Division Series in Detroit; Naylor Returns
snippets: With rain in the area, the pivotal Game 3 has been delayed.

Game 3 of the AL Division Series between the Seattle Mariners and Detroit Tigers has been delayed by rain.  Detroit was set to host Seattle with a late-afternoon start Tuesday, but the infield was covered within an hour of the scheduled first pitch.  The Tigers and Mariners split the first two games
Seattle Mariners first baseman Josh Naylor is in the lineup for Game 3 of the AL Division Series against the Detroit Tigers after dealing with a personal matter.
titles: Mariners vs. Tigers weather updates: Latest news on ALDS Game 3 rain delay
Tigers-Mariners ALDS Game 3 delayed by rain
Mariners’ Josh Naylor in lineup for Game 3 of ALDS vs. Tigers
summary: Game 3 of the AL Division Series between the Seattle Mariners and Detroit Tigers was delayed due to rain in Detroit. The teams, having split the first two games, were set for a late-afternoon start. Despite the delay, Seattle Mariners first baseman Josh Naylor is confirmed to be in the lineup for Game 3 after dealing with a personal matter.

title: AltStore PAL Expands to Japan, Brazil, Australia; UK Launch Set for 2026
snippets: AltStore PAL, which launched as one of the first alternative iOS app stores in the EU last year, is coming to more countries, developer Riley Testut announced today. “Specifically, we plan to launch in Japan, Brazil, and Australia before the end of the year, with the UK to follow in 2026,” Testut sa
The alternative app marketplace AltStore has raised $6 million and launched a Mastodon server.
titles: AltStore’s alternative iPhone app store is coming to more countries
Alternative app store AltStore raises $6M, connects with the fediverse
summary: AltStore PAL, an alternative iOS app store initially launched in the EU, is expanding to Japan, Brazil, and Australia by year's end, with a UK launch planned for 2026, as announced by developer Riley Testut. Additionally, AltStore has raised $6 million and launched a Mastodon server to support its growth.

title: EU Plans to Double UK Steel Tariff, Matching Trump's Rates
snippets: The EU is the destination for 78% of steel products made in the UK for overseas markets.

Starmer says UK in discussions with EU over Brussels plan to double import tariff to 50%, which unions warn could kill UK steel industry

The EU has announced it will match Donald Trump’s steel tariffs, doubling levies on imports to 50% in a decision condemned as “an existential threat” to t
titles: EU steel tariff hike threatens 'biggest ever crisis' for UK industry
EU plan to match Trump steel tariffs spurs ‘existential threat’ to UK steel industry
summary: The EU, receiving 78% of the UK's overseas steel exports, plans to double its import tariff to 50%, matching former US President Trump's rates. UK's Labour leader, Starmer, confirms discussions with the EU about this increase, which unions fear could devastate the UK steel industry.

title: Mastodon Launches "Packs" for Easier User Discovery at FediForum

It will work similarly to Starter Packs on Bluesky, which offer curated lists of accounts you can follo
Mastodon is planning to make it easier for newcomers to discover curated collections of users to follow by launching a new starter packs feature.

title: Jerry Jones Considers Appealing Fine for Accidental Obscene Gesture

Dallas owner Jerry Jones says his obscene gesture toward fans at MetLife Stadium late in a 37-22 victory over the New York Jets was inadvertent and that he intended a “thumbs up” for celebrating Cowboys fans.

summary: Tesla introduced a more affordable version of the Model Y SUV, priced just under $40,000, and a cheaper Model 3 sedan at approximately $37,000. These budget-friendly options were unveiled on Tuesday, expanding Tesla's electric vehicle offerings to a wider market.

summary: The Philadelphia Phillies are trailing 0-2 against the Los Angeles Dodgers in the National League Division Series (NLDS). The team is set to play Game 3 at the Dodgers' home on Wednesday, aiming to recover from their initial losses in the playoffs.

title: Victims of October 7 Attacks Remembered; Peace Talks Underway in Egypt
snippets: Israelis commemorated the second anniversary of the Hamas-led attacks on southern Israel as fighting continued. Ceasefire negotiations are ongoing in Egypt.
The somber milestone comes with peace talks underway, hostages from the Hamas-led attack still in Gaza, more than 67,000 Palestinians dead and Israel more isolated than ever.
titles: ‘Enough’: Israel marks 2 years since Oct. 7, with sounds of war from Gaza
Israel Marks Two-Year Anniversary of Oct. 7 in Subdued Fashion
summary: On the second anniversary of the October 7 attacks, friends and relatives commemorated victims at the Nova music festival site. Concurrently, peace talks related to Trump's 20-point plan are happening in Egypt, amidst a backdrop of ongoing hostage situations in Gaza, over 67,000 Palestinian deaths, and increased isolation for Israel.

title: Global Trade Surges in H1 2025 Amid Tariff Concerns
snippets: Global trade volumes rose sharply in the first half of 2025 as businesses front-loaded imports ahead of higher tariffs.
The World Trade Organization said trade growth had proved more resilient in 2025 than expected, but would slow next year as result of President Trump’s tariffs.
titles: WTO hikes global trade forecast for 2025 — but next year doesn't look so good
Global Trade Growth to Slow Sharply Next Year, W.T.O. Says
summary: In the first half of 2025, global trade volumes increased significantly as businesses accelerated imports in anticipation of higher tariffs. The World Trade Organization noted that trade growth in 2025 was more resilient than anticipated. However, it is expected to decelerate in the following year due to the implementation of tariffs by President Trump.

title: Filmmaker Says Late Father Would Disapprove of "TikTok Slop" AI Content
snippets: The filmmaker said it is not what her dad, who died in 2014, would have wanted.
'TikTok slop' is a term used to describe low-quality content generated using artificial intelligence that is often circulated on social media.
titles: Robin Williams' daughter pleads for people to stop sending AI videos of her dad
Robin Williams’ daughter slams those ‘puppeteering’ him with AI online
summary: A filmmaker commented that her father, who passed away in 2014, would not have approved of "TikTok slop," a term referring to low-quality content produced by artificial intelligence and widely shared on social media platforms.

title: SDF Integration Talks Stall Amid Syria Tensions
snippets: A landmark deal to integrate the SDF with state institutions has stalled as both sides accuse each other of violence.
Tensions have been building over government attempts to bring the Kurdish-led region in northeastern Syria under its authority. Kurdish leaders have so far resisted.
titles: Ceasefire declared between Syrian forces, Kurdish fighters after one killed
Deadly Clashes Erupt Between Syrian Government Forces and Kurdish Fighters
summary: A landmark agreement aimed at integrating the Syrian Democratic Forces (SDF) with state institutions in Syria has stalled. The delay is due to mutual accusations of violence between the parties involved. Tensions have escalated as the government attempts to assert control over the Kurdish-led northeastern region of Syria, which Kurdish leaders are resisting.

The situation highlights Trump's intent to override local authorities amid legal setbacks.
